Utility class for comparisons.

Method Detail

arrayEquals

public static boolean arrayEquals(int[] a1,
                                  int[] a2)
Checks whether the two passed in arrays are equal. To be equal, both arrays must have the same length and contain the same value at the same index.

Parameters:
a1 - the first array
a2 - the second array
Returns:
true iff the objects are equal

iteratorEquals

public static boolean iteratorEquals(Iterator i1,
                                     Iterator i2)
Checks whether the two iterators are equal. That is, the both have the same number of elements and each element is equal.

Parameters:
i1 - the first iterator
i2 - the second iterator
Returns:
true iff the iterators are equal

nullSafeEquals

public static boolean nullSafeEquals(Object o1,
                                     Object o2)
Null safe check for equality of two objects. This method returns true iff either both objects are null or equal according to Object.equals(java.lang.Object).

Parameters:
o1 - the first object
o2 - the second object
Returns:
true iff both objects are equal or both null

isSameTarget

public static boolean isSameTarget(Object o1,
                                   Object o2)
Determines whether two objects are the same or are advices advising the same target object.

Parameters:
o1 - the first object
o2 - the second object
Returns:
true if the two possible advised objects have the same target
